original_text:
**INSTITUTION
Cardiology
Discharge Summary
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , M M]
ACCOUNT# :
**ID-NUM
ATTENDING :
**NAME[YYY M] JR **NAME[ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Sep 15 2007] 17:44:00
DISCHARGE DATE :
**DATE[Sep 19 2007]
DIAGNOSES :
1. Right middle lobe pneumonia .
2. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease .
3. History of myocardial infarction .
4. Atrial fibrillation .
5. History of gastrointestinal bleed .
6. Carotid stenosis , status post endarterectomy .
7. Arthritis in multiple joints .
8. Chronic congestive heart failure .
9. Hyperlipidemia .
10. Hypertension .
11. Hypokalemia .
12. Right pleural effusion .
MEDICATIONS AT DISCHARGE :
1. Aspirin 81 mg daily .
2. Avodart 0.5 mg daily .
3. Feratab 300 mg twice a day with meals .
4. Hydralazine 50 mg daily .
5. Lopressor 12.5 mg twice a day .
6. Protonix 40 mg daily .
7. K-Dur 20 mEq daily .
8. Sertraline 50 mg daily .
9. Diovan 40 mg daily .
10. Atarax 50 mg daily .
11. Colace 100 mg daily .
12. Hydrocortisone cream as needed .
13. Lasix 40 mg daily .
14. Zoloft 50 mg daily .
15. Oxygen at 2 L as needed .
16. MiraLax as needed .
REASON FOR ADMISSION :
This is an **AGE[in 80s]- year - old male brought to the emergency room because of increasing weakness and shortness of breath along with chronic edema of the lower extremities .
He denied any chest pain or fever or chills .
Admission chest x-ray showed evidence of right middle lobe and right lower lobe pneumonia .
Blood cultures were drawn .
He was started on IV Zithromax and Rocephin .
It was also noticed that he had an elevated white count .
He does have a prior history of pneumonia 2 years ago , COPD , bronchitis , coronary artery disease , prior myocardial infarction , and atrial fibrillation for which he could not be on Coumadin because of history of GI bleed .
He has also had esophageal strictures and he has undergone recurrent dilatations by Dr. **NAME[VVV] .
He has carotid stenosis and has had endarterectomy and he has been treated for cellulitis and depression as well .
The patient denies any alcohol and tobacco products .
It was also noted on arrival that his BNP level was 723 , suspected secondary to chronic congestive heart failure .
ADDITIONAL LABORATORY :
Initial electrolytes were normal at one point .
Potassium was low and was repleted .
BUN and creatinine was 17 and 1.5 .
Glucose 138 .
Hemoglobin and hematocrit were 13 and 39.2 .
White count was 12,400 .
INR 1.0 .
BNP 723 .
Blood cultures showed no growth .
At discharge , glucose was 106 , BUN and creatinine 15 and 1.4 , potassium level was 3.2 , which was repleted , and white count was down to 8300 .
Initial chest x-ray in the emergency department showed evidence of right middle lobe and right lower lobe pneumonia .
CAT scan of the chest showed fibrotic changes , which were felt to be old .
No pulmonary embolism .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
The patient was admitted because of weakness and shortness of breath and diagnosed with pneumonia .
Blood cultures were negative .
He was started on IV antibiotics of Rocephin and Zithromax with aggressive pulmonary toilet .
O2 saturations were monitored closely and a pulmonary evaluation was requested to Dr. **NAME[UUU] .
In addition , Dr. **NAME[UUU] did order a CAT scan of the chest , which showed old fibrotic changes .
WBC count was monitored as well and he also added oxygen in addition to aggressive pulmonary toilet .
BNP level was elevated .
The patient does have a history of congestive heart failure and was continued on cardiac regimen of weight and taken output along with aspirin , hydralazine , Lopressor , Diovan , and Lasix .
Electrolytes were followed and repleted .
Potassium was replaced and BUN and creatinine were monitored .
Hypertension was controlled .
He also had arthritis at multiple joints and anemia for which iron supplements were continued .
The patient responded well to cardiac and pulmonary regimen .
At discharge , he was free of chest pain and shortness of breath .
He remained afebrile .
Atrial fibrillation was controlled .
The patient also had hyperglycemia and Accu-Cheks were monitored .
Glucose was 106 at discharge .
White count was normal .
O2 saturation was 97% .
Dr. **NAME[UUU] felt that the patient at this time was stable for discharge .
He will continue to use oxygen at 2 L along with following a cardiac diet .
No heavy lifting over 10 pounds .
His PCP , Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] , will see him within 2 weeks .
**INSTITUTION **PLACE and Home Health nurses will follow for both cardiac and pulmonary assessments and continue with physical therapy .
Electrolytes , BUN , and creatinine will be done weekly .
If the patient does experience any further chest pain , shortness of breath , hemoptysis , or fever over 101 , Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] is to be notified .
The patient understood all instructions .
_________________________
**NAME[YYY M] JR **NAME[ZZZ]
DICTATED BY :
**NAME[WWW XXX] , R.N.
SC/nks
D :
**DATE[Sep 22 2007] 14:26:32
T :
**DATE[Sep 22 2007] 17:48:06
R :
**DATE[Sep 22 2007] 17:48:06/nks
Job ID :

<end header>

-**NAME[XXX , TTT] ***
Electronically Signed by **NAME[YYY ZZZ] JR
**DATE[Sep 26 2007] 08:27:40 AM
